I am a data scientist in the innovation lab at the French national institute of statistics ([Insee](https://www.insee.fr/fr/accueil)) ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡·. I study how the combination of new data sources and new methods can deepen our understanding of socioeconomic phenomena. I am particularly interested in the exploitation of textual data or spatial data. 

I mostly work with `Python` {{< fa brands python >}}, {{< fa brands r-project >}} and `Javascript` {{< fa brands js-square >}}. 


Most of my work is available on my {{< fa brands github >}} [Github page](https://github.com/linogaliana) or
the {{< fa brands github >}} [Github page](https://github.com/inseefrlab)
of the Insee's Lab. 
Among my main open source projects, I maintain the [`utilitR` project](https://www.utilitr.org/) which is a collective effort involving many people from French administration to propose a high-quality documentation regarding {{< fa brands r-project >}} software. 

I currently teach [*Python for data scientists*](https://pythonds.linogaliana.fr/) 
([Github repository](https://github.com/linogaliana/python-datascientist) {{< fa brands github >}})
at `ENSAE Paris Tech`,
one of the top French engineering school. 
In the same engineering school, I also teach a course [_"Data science projects in production: from good practices to MLOps"_](https://ensae-reproductibilite.github.io/website/)
([`Github` repository](https://github.com/ensae-reproductibilite/website) {{< fa brands github >}})
that brings student to the question of _state of the art_ MLOps.
I also give an [introduction to {{< fa brands r-project >}}](https://rgeo.linogaliana.fr/) ([`Github` repository](https://github.com/linogaliana/r-geographie) {{< fa brands github >}}), an introductory course at [Ecole Normale SupÃ©rieure](https://www.geographie.ens.psl.eu/introduction-aux-methodes.html) for data analysis.
